concepts.name: Logical Trait
concepts.description: The logical trait in E&P Sexuality theory

content_excerpts:
Dispelling Myths
Extroverts vs Introverts
“Physicals are extroverts, Emotionals are introverts.”
This is the most common misconception about the model. While we generally expect Physicals to be more
extroverted, a shy Physical or an Emotional who is extroverted due to their job, career, or specific training can
exist. This is merely a surface trait.
Emotional vs Logical
While Physicals are often more heart-driven and Emotionals more head-driven, this distinction is not a core trait.

content_excerpts:
301-1 – Emotional and Physical Sexuality 1
Presented By: George J. Kappas, MA, LMFT, CCHt
Developed by HMI Founder Dr. John Kappas, PhD, LMFT, the model of Emotional and Physical Sexuality (E&P) is
without question, one of HMI’s most powerful tools for understanding and predicting the behavior of clients. In this
lesson, HMI Director and Marriage Family Therapist George Kappas will introduce you to the E&P model in a
presentation you are not likely to forget.
Completed: Thu, Sep 4, 2025 / Score:

13. Reasons for Infidelity
14. Power Dyna

The initial version of the Emotional and Physical (E&P) model was nicknamed the "silent conspiracy." This was based
on the observation that most therapists tended to score higher on the Physical personality scale. As a result, they
often viewed their own perspectives and approaches to relationships as the norm. If a client's perspective differed,
therapists might unknowingly attempt to "correct" them, failing to recognize that there are two equally valid sets of
norms. The authors of the model a

content_excerpts:
Emotional and Physical Sexuality
The Emotional and Physical Sexuality model was authored by Dr. John Kappas in the early 1970s and was a unique
and revolutionary model in that it completely dismissed gender as a basis for understanding and predicting behavior
in relationships. Many, if not most, relationship models then and today rely on gender as the main understanding of
behavior in relationships. Dr. Kappas relied on years of work with clients, as well as discussion, debate, and
comparisons w

Rules for this Lecture
To learn the basics of the E&P Sexuality model, please refrain from using any of these words and be careful not to
confuse the Sexuality model with any of this model.
Do not confuse the concept of E&P “Suggestibility” with “E&P Sexuality.” To avoid this confusion, we ban the
word “Suggestibility completely from this lesson.
Do not bring up the concepts or use the words “Defense Mechanism,” “Incongruency,” or “Ethnic Sexuality” in
this lesson. We will defer those concepts t

The Four Core Traits
1. Relationship to the Physical Body
Physicals: Physicals have a strong connection with their physical body and process emotions through their
bodies and minds.
They experience emotions immediately and physically.
They don’t need to think about how they feel; it’s instinctive.
They interact with the world through their physical body, often expressing themselves through touch
and closeness.
Emotionals: Emotionals have a more disconnected relationship with their physical body
